title.narrative: Programme d'Appui au Développement de l'Agriculture Burkina Faso, PADAB 2

description.narrative:
The overall aim of the Agriculture Program is to contribute to achieving the objectives of Burkina Faso's strategy for rural development aiming at increased economic growth, increased income in rural areas and improved food security. Responsibility for implementation of the strategy is embedded in three different ministries : Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Environment and the Ministry of Livestock .
The program is divided into 3 components :
1 ) Support the development of the three ministries' capacity to plan, implement and monitor the strategy for rural areas. An important element is the development of a national agricultural program.
2 ) Support to poverty reduction and economic development of the rural areas in three regions. This is done partly through support to the authorities and partly via the regional development funds in each of the 3 regions, where individual farmers and associations can apply for money to fund micro-projects, which would help increasing and diversifying their income.
3) Support to the improvement of the rural population's access to micro-credits by strengthening local microcredit institutions and ensuring the sustainability of these institutions. This includes: support to implementation of the national action plan for micro-financing , which is funded jointly with 2 other donors ( Canada and UNDP ) and support to a guarantee fund, which increases the willingness of banks to lend money to micro-credit institutions.
